I've watched almost every one of your videos, and spaced and did this yesterday without reference. Oddly enough, you can go to the orange store site and search dichloromethane and it will bring up a list of products. That store lists data sheets online and must have them tied in to their search engine (could be useful for other products in future). Anyway, I found several that only contain DCM and methane and come in liquid form (I bought a liquid/sprayable 15-minute version that comes with a handy spray bottle). Separation was simple with regular distillation and yielded about 530ml from a quart ($11.99). I hit the first batch with water thinking it might separate the methane and got the emulsion. I kept shaking and separating with the DCM I removed and the emulsion finally broke that way after about 6 separations. This morning, I remembered your video and will use your further filtration suggestion to remove the Methane. Thanks as always for super interesting, informative videos! This is certainly a Youtube favorite for me!
